document.masterDocTitle: Sepedon (Diptera: Sciomyzidae) species from China, with notes on taxonomy and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sepedon (Diptera: Sciomyzidae) species from China, with notes on taxonomy and distribution

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sepedon senex Wiedemann, 1830
. Ausser. Zweifl. Ins. 2: 578. Type locality: not given.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 41–51.
Sepedon plumbella Wiedemann.
41. Male habitus, lateral view. 42. Female habitus, lateral view. 43. Frons, frontal view. 44. Foreleg, lateral view (showing twisted basitarsus). 45. Head, lateral view. 46. Male Sternum 5 and terminalia, ventral view. 47. Male postabdomen (cochleate vesicle inside), caudal view. 48. Male terminalia, lateral view. 49. Hypandrium (left part), lateral view. 50. Aedeagus and apodemes, lateral view. 51. Aedeagus and apodemes, ventral view.

FIGURES 52–60.
Sepedon senex Wiedemann.
52. Female habitus, lateral view. 53. Frons, frontal view. 54. Head, lateral view. 55. Sternum 5. 56. Male postabdomen (cochleate vesicle inside), caudal view. 57. Male postabdomen (cochleate vesicle inside), lateral view. 58. Hypandrium (left part), lateral view. 59. Aedeagus and apodemes, lateral view. 60. Aedeagus and apodemes, ventral view.

. X. 23 , Shu-Yong Wang (1♂, IZCAS).

Distribution. China ( Yunnan , Hainan , Taiwan , Hong Kong ); Thailand , Burma , Sumatra, Malaya, India , Philippines , Java.
Oriental Region
( Yano, 1968 ; Steyskal, 1980 ).

Remarks. This species is similar to
S. plumbella
in external characters, especially in females. In
S. senex
the fore basitarsus of both sexes are normal in appearance, so it is not easy to distinguish between females of
S. plumbella
and
S. senex
at first glance. Characters for separating the two species are as shown in couplet 4 of the key.
